column5: How much snow cover has the Red Lake/Ear Falls area received this year? Last year the snow cover was pretty slim and thus made the water levels lower than usual. I fly out of Ear Falls (50 miles west) with Showalter's to Hammerhead. It's on the Gammon R. flowage.
The snowfall the last two winters was abnormally light. This year it has gotten back to normal, I can't really give you an estimate in inches, but there's easily twice as much snow.
